prompt: Generate realistic text messages that represent non-spam (ham) content. These messages should reflect a broad spectrum of everyday communication, including personal conversations, legitimate business or service notifications, casual updates, and automated alerts. Vary the tone (friendly, professional, neutral, concerned), language style (informal chats, formal announcements, concise or detailed), and topics (meeting or appointment reminders, family or friend check-ins, order or delivery confirmations, bank transaction alerts, community or event updates). Include diverse formats like quick one-word replies, detailed explanations, friendly greetings, or automated system messages (e.g., OTP codes, subscription reminders). Ensure the content simulates authentic, non-malicious communication across different contexts, relationships, and platforms, avoiding any deceptive or promotional undertones.
response:
Hey, just checking in. How’s your day going?  
Reminder: Your meeting with the marketing team is at 2 PM tomorrow.  
Your order has been shipped! Expected delivery is on Thursday.  
Just wanted to say I’m thinking of you. Let’s catch up soon!  
Your OTP code is 123456. Please enter it to continue.  
Do you want to grab lunch this weekend?  
I received your email and will get back to you shortly.  
The community event is happening this Saturday at the park. Hope to see you there!  
Just paid the electricity bill. Everything is up to date.  
Are you free for a quick chat later?  
Your subscription will renew on the 15th. Let us know if you have any questions.  
Congratulations! You’ve been selected for the final interview.  
I left the book you lent me on the kitchen table.  
Please confirm your attendance for the wedding by next week.  
Your bank account has been credited with $500.  
I’m running late; I’ll be at the café in 15 minutes.  
Can you pick up the groceries on your way home?  
Your flight is on schedule for departure at 5 PM.  
Just wanted to remind you about the dentist appointment tomorrow at 3 PM.  
Thanks for your help with the project! I appreciate it.  
The concert tickets are sold out. Let’s look for another event.  
What do you think about the new restaurant downtown?  
Your password has been successfully updated.  
Looking forward to the family reunion next month!  
I need your input on the proposal draft by Friday.  
The weather looks great for the picnic this Sunday!  
I’m here if you need to talk. Just send me a message.  
Your package has been delivered! Check your front porch.  
Let’s meet at the usual spot at 5 PM?  
Happy birthday! Can’t wait to celebrate with you tonight!  
Please remember to take your medication this evening.  
Your feedback on the recent survey would be greatly appreciated.  
I found the missing keys in the living room.  
Thanks for the reminder about the payment due date!  
Is the presentation ready for tomorrow’s meeting?  
The car service is confirmed for 10 AM on Tuesday.  
I’m so proud of you for finishing that project!  
The book club meeting is rescheduled for next week.  
I’ll send over the documents shortly for your review.  
Your gym membership is due for renewal next month.  
I’m thinking of starting a new hobby—any suggestions?  
The kids had a great time at the party yesterday!  
Just a heads up, there’s a traffic jam on Main Street.  
Your account statement is ready for review.  
Thanks for helping me with the move last weekend!  
The online class starts at 6 PM tonight.  
I’ll be out of the office next week, but I’ll check emails periodically.  
Are you able to join the conference call this Friday?  
The new exhibit at the museum opens this weekend.  
I hope you feel better soon! Let me know if you need anything.  
Your appointment has been successfully canceled.  
I’m excited to see the new movie this Friday!  
The pet grooming appointment is set for tomorrow at 1 PM.
